forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 5am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind around 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West wind 7 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco, the night embraces a gentle warmth, whispering through the streets as a slight breeze stirs the clouds aloft. As dawn edges closer, a faint chance of rain lingers in the air, but for now, the city remains mostly obscured by a mottled sky, hinting at a fleeting touch of summer to come. Temperatures hover around a comfortable 52 degrees, as the clouds play their game of hide-and-seek with the night lights, creating an atmospheric tapestry that is both intriguing and serene. 

As the sun begins its ascent, expect a transformation into a predominantly sunny day, brightening the cityscape with an inviting glow. The high will reach towards the upper fifties, with cooler afternoon breezes nudging the temperature down gently. The breeze from the west, offering a refreshing touch, may stir up slight gusts, reminding you of the embrace of the ocean nearby. Dress in layers to navigate this dynamic day—perhaps a light jacket over a breathable shirt will suit the spirit of the morning and the warmth that follows. A stroll along the waterfront, with its panoramic views, seems perfect under this gentle transition, allowing one to relish the serene beauty of the bay as nature stirs towards spring.
